intro: Lappula mexicana, commonly known as Mexican lappula, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, which includes many species adapted to arid environments. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent leaves. It has a sprawling growth habit and often forms dense mats. Due to its drought tolerance, it is sometimes used in xeriscaping and ecological restoration projects.
